author: info@gomhuriognline.com, gomhuriognline
title: طلاب العلمي يصرخون من صعوبة الفيزياء .. والأدبي يحتفل بالتاريخ
text:
تصاعدت شكاوى طلاب الثانوية العامة من الشعبة العلمية اليوم بعد أداء امتحان مادة الفيزياء، الذي وصفوه بـ"الصعب والمعقد"، مشيرين إلى أن غالبية الأسئلة جاءت غير مباشرة وتحتاج إلى وقت أطول وجهد ذهني يفوق قدرات الطالب المتوسط. وأكد الطلاب أن بعض الأسئلة، خاصة المخصصة لدرجتين، جاءت على نحو لا يتناسب مع الوقت المحدد، في حين اقتصرت السهولة فقط على أسئلة الدرجة الواحدة والمقالية، ما خلق تباينًا واضحًا في مستوى الامتحان.
في المقابل، عبّر طلاب الشعبة الأدبية عن ارتياحهم الشديد عقب امتحان مادة التاريخ، الذي اعتبروه سهلاً ومباشرًا، وجاء في مستوى الطالب المتوسط، معتمدًا على النماذج الاسترشادية وكتيب المفاهيم، ما أثار تساؤلات حول العدالة في توزيع مستويات الصعوبة بين الشعبتين.
ورغم هذا التفاوت، واصل وزير التربية والتعليم والتعليم الفني متابعته لسير الامتحانات من داخل غرفة العمليات المركزية بديوان الوزارة، عبر كاميرات المراقبة، حيث أظهرت المشاهد حالة من الانضباط داخل اللجان، دون الإشارة إلى شكاوى الطلاب أو الصعوبات التي واجهوها، ما دفع البعض للتشكيك في فعالية المتابعة الميدانية.
ويؤدي قرابة 813 ألف طالب وطالبة امتحانات الثانوية العامة بنظاميها القديم والجديد في العام الدراسي 2025، وسط دعوات من أولياء الأمور إلى ضرورة مراعاة الفروق الفردية بين الطلاب، خاصة في المواد العلمية التي تحدد مصير طلاب كليات القمة.
ويؤدي طلاب الثانوية العامة امتحانات آخر العام بنظام الثانوية العامة الجديد ونظام الثانوية العامة القديم، خلال الفترة من يوم الأحد الموافق 22 يونيو الجاري الى يوم الخميس الموافق 10 يوليو المقبل.
وتختتم امتحانات الثانوية العامة نظام جديد يوم الخميس الموافق 10 يوليو المقبل في مادة الاحياء لطلاب الثانوية العامة شعبة العلوم، وفي مادة الرياضيات التطبيقية لطلاب الثانوية العامة شعبة الرياضيات، وفي مادة الاحصاء لطلاب الثانوية العامة شعبة الأدبي.
ممكن تسجل بياناتك لتصلك نتيجة الثانوية العامة فورا اعتمادها
وتحرص بوابة الجمهورية أون لاين على تقديم خدماتها لطلاب وطالبات الثانوية العامة بالنظام الجديد وأيضا لطلاب الثانوية العامة النظام القديم في بث نتيجة الثانوية العامة 2025 على بوابة الجمهورية أون لاين كعادتها كل عام، وعلى كل طالب أو طالبة يريد معرفة نتيجة الثانوية العامة 2025 من خلال التواصل مع بوابة الجمهورية أون لاين، وذلك من خلال ملئ البيانات على هذا الرابط.. لتصلك النتيجة فور إعلانها دون تكلفة البحث والعناء على المواقع الاخبارية.. وللدخول على رابط معرفة النتيجة من هن .
https://natega.gomhuriaonline.com/
تابع بوابة الجمهورية اون لاين علي
جوجل نيوز

author: world today news
title: Meet Asteroid Ryugu, Older than the Solar
text:
This implies that asteroids may play an necessary function in bringing the foundations of life to Earth.
One other attention-grabbing discovery from the Ryugu samples is proof of the presence of water up to now. This implies that Ryugu could have had an underground ocean or lake, which may have been a spot for microorganisms to dwell.
Introduced from Science Alert on Thursday (04/07/2024), consultants have additionally been actively learning materials from the Ryugu asteroid. From the outcomes of this analysis, it was revealed that the asteroid Ryugu consists of a composition much like carbonaceous chondrite.
Chondrites are a sort of (non-metallic) rock meteorite that has not undergone any change from its authentic type. Such a meteor is created from various kinds of mud and particles of matter that existed within the prehistory of the photo voltaic system or on primitive asteroids.
As well as, the most recent examine discovered an abundance of heavy hydrogen and nitrogen substances. Each supplies are according to sources exterior the Photo voltaic System.
This makes consultants suspect that the asteroid Ryugu is older than the solar. This concept corresponds to the idea of comets, which says that they arrive from photo voltaic methods additional away.
(Tiffany)
2024-07-04 20:00:00
#Meet #Asteroid #Ryugu #Older #Solar

author: Ramkumar
title: Chennai on flood alert as Chembarambakkam, Poondi, Puzhal reservoirs release water
text:
[Tamil Nadu News](https://www.news9live.com/state/tamil-nadu)
Chennai on flood alert as Chembarambakkam, Poondi, Puzhal reservoirs release water
Chennai is on high alert as water is being released from the Chembarambakkam, Poondi, and Puzhal reservoirs following heavy rains. Authorities have issued flood warnings for low-lying areas, urging residents to evacuate and stay updated on safety measures
Chennai: Authorities issued a flood alert for low-lying areas along the Adyar River banks after releasing 1,000 cusecs of water from Chembarambakkam reservoir today. The reservoir, with a full capacity of 24 feet, currently stands at 23.29 feet, with inflows rising to 6,500 cusecs.
The decision to release water came after heavy rains pounded the Kanchipuram district, with the Chembarambakkam area recording 14 cm rainfall yesterday. This led to a significant increase in inflows, from 743 cubic feet yesterday morning to 6,500 cusecs currently.
முன்னெச்சரிக்கை நடவடிக்கைகள் செம்பரம்பாக்கம் ஏரியிலிருந்து நீர் வெளியேற்றம் 13.12.2024
[pic.twitter.com/8vQXvT50hK]— tnsdma (@tnsdma)
[December 13, 2024]
Flood Warnings for Low-Lying Areas
Residents in low-lying areas along the Adyar River banks have been advised to evacuate to relief camps. Water has now been released from the three largest lakes around Chennai – Chembarambakkam, Poondi and Puzhal lakes – resulting in water flowing into the city’s rivers.
Chembarambakkam Lake’s water level rose from 21.50 feet yesterday to over 23 feet, prompting officials to release surplus water. An order was issued to release 1,000 cubic feet per second after the water level crossed 22 feet. Flood warnings have been issued for villages along the banks, including Thirumudivakkam, Sirukalathur, Nandambakkam, Thiruneermalai and Vazhuthalampedu.
Poondi Lake, another key water source for Chennai, has also seen increased water release. Currently, 12,760 cubic feet of water are being released, up from 5,000 cubic feet yesterday. With Poondi Lake overflowing at its full height of 35 feet, officials released additional water as a safety precaution. Puzhal Lake also releases 500 cubic feet of water.
The 2015 Chennai floods were largely caused by water release from Chembarambakkam Lake. While officials from the Water Resources Department and Public Works Department are closely monitoring the situation, residents remain concerned. Authorities ensure that necessary measures are being taken to ensure public safety.
Evacuation efforts are underway, with residents advised to avoid travel to flood-prone areas and follow official updates. The situation remains under close watch as authorities work to mitigate potential flooding.
Click for more latest [Tamil Nadu news](https://www.news9live.com/state/tamil-nadu). Also get top headlines and [latest news](/latest-news) from [India](/india) and around the [world](/world) at News9.

author: newsdirectory3
title: West Island Clinic Closure Threatens Thousands’ Healthcare Access
text:
West Island⁢ Residents Fear Loss ⁤of Vital Emergency Clinic Pointe-Claire, Quebec – The potential closure of Statcare Emergency Clinic in Pointe-Claire has sent shockwaves through the community, leaving thousands of patients worried about losing access⁢ to crucial healthcare services.‌
Last week, ELNA Medical, the clinic’s owner, was granted creditor protection , raising serious concerns about the ⁣clinic’s future.
Catherine Brady, a longtime patient whose family ⁤has ‌relied​ on Statcare for over a decade, expressed ‍her deep concern. “It’s going to affect the West Island in a huge way,” she⁣ said. “My doctor is worried too.⁣ it’s unsustainable for us not ‍to have this clinic; it⁤ needs to stay‌ open.”
Adding to the anxiety, a source told CTV News that statcare will be ​laying off four employees, further fueling⁣ speculation about the clinic’s imminent ⁤closure.
Pointe-Claire Mayor Tim Thomas echoed the community’s fears, warning of the devastating impact a closure would have on the already strained healthcare system. “The already overwhelmed emergency room at Lakeshore general‍ Hospital will be bursting at the seams,” he said. “There’s unlimited demand for these​ services. How is it unable to operate?”
While ELNA ‌Medical’s insolvency trustee, Benoit Fontaine, has ‍not ‍responded to‌ requests for comment, ‌he previously stated that if the clinic closes, staff and patients would‍ be transferred to other healthcare facilities.
The health authority responsible⁣ for the clinic has yet to receive an official closure notice from ELNA Medical but is ​actively assessing the potential consequences for the‌ region should the clinic shut its doors.
West Island Residents Fear Loss of⁤ Vital ⁣Emergency Clinic pointe-Claire, ⁤Quebec – Fear adn uncertainty‌ grip the⁢ West Island community ‌as the future of Statcare Emergency Clinic hangs in the⁣ balance. ​Last ‌week, ELNA Medical, ​the clinic’s owner, was granted creditor protection, sparking concerns ‌about the clinic’s looming closure and the devastating impact it would ​have on​ thousands of patients reliant on its vital ‌services.
Longtime patient Catherine Brady, whose family has depended on Statcare for over‍ a⁣ decade, voiced her⁢ deep apprehension. “It’s going to affect the West Island in a ​huge way,” she ‌said.”My ‍doctor is worried too. It’s unsustainable for us⁣ not to have this clinic; it needs to stay open.”
Adding fuel to the fire, a source close⁤ to the situation revealed⁢ to CTV⁤ News⁣ that ⁤Statcare will be‍ laying off four employees, further intensifying speculation about the clinic’s imminent closure.
Pointe-Claire ⁣Mayor Tim Thomas echoed the community’s fears, highlighting​ the ⁢potential strain on an already overburdened healthcare system. “The already overwhelmed emergency room at Lakeshore General Hospital⁣ will be bursting at the ⁣seams,”‌ he warned.⁢ “There’s unlimited demand for these services. How is it unable to operate?”
While Benoit Fontaine, the insolvency trustee overseeing ‍ELNA Medical, has remained tight-lipped, declining ‍to comment on the situation, he previously stated that in the event of closure, ⁢staff and patients would⁢ be redirected to other healthcare facilities.
The health ⁤authority ‍responsible⁤ for the clinic has yet to receive an official closure notification from ELNA Medical but ⁣is actively evaluating the potential repercussions for the region ⁢should Statcare cease operations.
